title: C++ Booleans
text: Very often, in programming, you will need a data type that can only have one of two values, like:

For this, C++ has a bool data type, which can take the values true 
(1) or false (0).

title: Boolean Values
text: A boolean variable is declared with the bool keyword and can take the values true or false:
From the example above, you can read that a true value returns 1, and false returns 0.
However, it is more common to return a boolean value by comparing values and variables (see next page).

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
bool isCodingFun = true;bool isFishTasty = false;cout << isCodingFun;  
  // Outputs 1 (true)cout << isFishTasty;  // Outputs 0 (false)
